b'Now they\xe2\x80\x99ve just sent me an email, subject: UPS Update: Package Scheduled for Delivery Today, and it absolutely promises that the package is on its way and will definitely arrive by 7pm on Saturday. Meanwhile the truck and map have vanished from the app. They\xe2\x80\x99re toying with me.'

b'On closer examination the truck appears just to be parked  for the night at the Kingston NY UPS facility. I think all the app\xe2\x80\x99s promises that My Package is Very Close and Definitely Still On Its Way To Me are well-meaning fibs.'
b'I\xe2\x80\x99m still in there with a chance. There\xe2\x80\x99s a little truck showing up on the App about 10 miles away. Fingers very crossed.'

b"How late should one stop refreshing the UPS app that promises that the thing you are waiting for will arrive by 7 pm and realise that there are no lost UPS trucks out there, with a lone driver determined that I'll get my package before they knock off for the night? (It's 9:15 pm)"

b"Martha Thomases, then DC Comics publicist, convinced the people at DC that we should do it. A free 8 page comic, to go to comic shops, that they could give to schools and libraries. I'm sure lots of copies were thrown away, but perhaps lives were saved too. I'm still proud of it."

b"I finished rewatching It's A Sin, and remembered talking to Don Melia about Life and Death and Sandman. He was dying of AIDS at home in Liverpool. This was August 92, a week or two before his death. He made me determined to write a free comic about sex, needles and staying alive. https://t.co/zmDz6woutd"
